metadata.dc:title: Group psychotherapy in patients with borderline personality disorder
metadata.dc:description: Borderline personality disorder is the most frequent personality disorder. With a 2% of prevalence in general population and up to 60% over all personality disorders, nowadays it is still an important psychopathological diagnostic and therapeutic challenge for mental health professionals. The present paper establishes the basis of a group psychotherapy experience with some borderline patients, showing some basic principles of group intervention with these people, analyzing the different therapy focuses: goal definitions, session design, communication of feelings, conflict areas management, improvement of familiar and interpersonal relationships and improvement of social skills. Finally it is made a result evaluation not only individually but also in a collective way, suggesting possible trends for future collective interventions
